description: A real push button (switch) available in several colors.
exclusion:
Removing (Exclusion) - Z-Wave device learning mode, allowing to remove the device from existing Z-Wave network.

To remove the device to the Z-Wave network:

  1. Place the Button within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.
  2. Set the main controller in remove mode (see the controller’s manual).
  3. Click the Button at least six times.
  4. Wait for the removing process to end.
  5. Successful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.
inclusion:
Adding (Inclusion) - Z-Wave device learning mode, allowing to add the device to existing Z-Wave network.

To add the device to the Z-Wave network:

  1. Place the Button within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.
  2. Set the main controller in (Security/non-Security) add mode (see the controller’s manual).
  3. Click the Button at least six times.
  4. Wait for the adding process to end.
  5. Successful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.
label: FGPB101
overview:
FIBARO Button is a compact, battery-powered, Z-Wave Plus compatible device. It allows you to control devices through the Z-Wave network and run various scenes defined in FIBARO System.

Different actions may be triggered with one to five clicks or by holding the button down. In panic mode, each press of the button results in triggering the FIBARO Alarm.

With its small design and wireless communication, the FIBARO Button can be conveniently mounted on any surface and in any position or location at home, e.g. beside the bed or under the desk.

Main features of FIBARO Button:

  • Compatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave+ Controller
  • Supports Z-Wave network Security Mode with AES-128 encryption
  • Completely wireless with battery power and Z-Wave communication
  • May be installed anywhere in your home
  • Extremely easy installation - simply add and put on desired surface
  • Many colour variations: black, white, red, green, blue, yellow, orange and brown.
wakeup: The Button needs to be woken up to receive information about the new configuration from the controller, like parameters and associations. Click the Button 4 times to wake it up.

category.label: Remote Control
category.description: Any portable or hand-held device that controls the status of something, e.g. remote control, keyfob etc.

parameters.label: Scenes sent to the controller
parameters.description: This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs to them.
parameters.overview:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs and attributes assigned to them.

Available settings:

1 - Key Pressed 1 time
2 - Key Pressed 2 times 
4 - Key Pressed 3 times
8 - Key Pressed 4 times
16 - Key Pressed 5 times
32 - Key Held Down
64 - Key Released

Values of parameter 1 may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes will be sent after pressing the button once or twice.

parameters.label: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
parameters.description: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network Security Mode. It does not apply to 1st „Lifeline” group.

1 - 2nd group sent as secure
2 - 3rd group sent as secure
4 - 4th group sent as secure

Values of parameter 3 may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd & 3rd group are sent as secure

parameters.label: Key Pressed 1 time – command sent to 2nd group
parameters.description: Associated in 2nd association group after a single click.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a single click.

Available settings:

0 - no action
1 - SWITCH ON
2 - SWITCH OFF
3 - SWITCH ON/OFF – alternately

parameters.label: Key Pressed 1 time – value ON sent to 2nd group
parameters.description: Value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 2nd association group
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 2nd association group after a single click.

Available settings:

1-255 - sent value

parameters.label: Key Pressed 2 times – command sent to 2nd group
parameters.description: Commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a double click.

Available settings:

0 - no action
1 - SWITCH ON
2 - SWITCH OFF
3 - SWITCH ON/OFF – alternately

parameters.label: Key Pressed 2 times – value ON sent to 2nd group
parameters.description: SWITCH ON command in 2nd association group after double click
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 2nd association group after a double click.

Available settings:

1-255 - sent value

parameters.label: Key Pressed 3 times 2nd group command
parameters.description: Commands associated in 2nd association group after a triple click.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 2nd association group after a triple click.

Available settings:

0 - no action
1 - SWITCH ON
2 - SWITCH OFF
3 - SWITCH ON/OFF – alternately

parameters.label: Key Pressed 3 times – value  ON to 2nd group
parameters.description: SWITCH ON  sent in 2nd association group after 3 presses
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 2nd association group after a triple click.

Available settings:

1-255 - sent value

parameters.label: Key Pressed 1 time – command sent to 3rd group
parameters.description: Ssent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a single click.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a single click.

Available settings:

0 - no action
1 - SWITCH ON
2 - SWITCH OFF
3 - SWITCH ON/OFF – alternately

parameters.label: Key Pressed 1 time – value  ON sent to 3rd group
parameters.description: Value of SWITCH ON command sent in 3rd association group after a single click.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 3rd association group after a single click.

Available settings:

1-255 - sent value

parameters.label: Key Pressed 2 times – command sent to 3rd group
parameters.description: Sent to associated in 3rd association group after a double click.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a double click.

Available settings:

0 - no action
1 - SWITCH ON
2 - SWITCH OFF
3 - SWITCH ON/OFF – alternately

parameters.label: Key Pressed 2 times – value ON sent to 3rd group
parameters.description: Value of SWITCH ON command sent in 3rd association group after a double click.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 3rd association group after a double click.

Available settings:

1-255 - sent value

parameters.label: Key Pressed 3 times – command sent to 3rd group
parameters.description: Sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a triple click.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after a triple click.

Available settings:

0 - no action
1 - SWITCH ON
2 - SWITCH OFF
3 - SWITCH ON/OFF – alternately

parameters.label: Key Pressed 3 times – value ON sent to 3rd group
parameters.description: Value SWITCH ON command sent in 3rd association group after a triple click.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines value of SWITCH ON command sent to devices in 3rd association group after a triple click.

Available settings:

1-255 - sent value

parameters.label: Key Held Down – command sent to 3rd group
parameters.description: Sent associated in 3rd association group after holding the button down.
parameters.overview:
This parameter defines commands sent to devices associated in 3rd association group after holding the button down.

Available settings:

0 - no action
1 - START LEVEL CHANGE UP (brightening)
2 - START LEVEL CHANGE DOWN (dimming)
3 - START LEVEL CHANGE UP/DOWN (brightening/dimming) – alternately

parameters.label: Alarm frame triggers
parameters.description: Which actions result in sending alarm frames to 4th association group.
parameters.overview:
Parameter determines which actions result in sending alarm frames to 4th association group.

Available settings:

1 - Key Pressed 1 time
2 - Key Pressed 2 times
4 - Key Pressed 3 times
8 - Key Pressed 4 times
16 - Key Pressed 5 times
32 - Key Held Down
64 - Key Released

Values of parameter 30 may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that alarm frames will be sent after pressing the button once or twice.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default)

associations.label: On/Off
associations.description: assigned to clicking the button and is used to turn on/off associated devices

associations.label: Dimmer
associations.description: is assigned to holding the button and is used to change level of associated devices

associations.label: Alarm
associations.description: assigned to clicking and/or holding the button (triggers are defined in parameter 30) and is used to send alarm frames to associated devices
